Class MasonryCompat

java.lang.Object
com.Ev0sMods.Ev0sChisel.compat.MasonryCompat
public final class MasonryCompat extends Object
Compatibility layer for Ymmersive Masonry.

When the mod is installed, this class provides masonry variant block keys grouped by stone type. Stairs and half-slabs are excluded â€“ only full blocks are offered as chisel substitutions.

  • Method Details

    • init

      public static void init()
      Probes the classpath for net.conczin.YmmersiveMasonry. If found, populates the variant map.

    • isAvailable

      public static boolean isAvailable()
      Returns:
      true when Ymmersive Masonry is present on this server

    • getVariants

      public static List<String> getVariants(String stoneType)
      Returns the masonry full-block variant keys for the given stone type, or an empty list if the type is unknown or masonry is absent.

    • getStairVariants

      public static List<String> getStairVariants(String stoneType)
      Returns the masonry stair variant keys for the given stone type.

    • getHalfVariants

      public static List<String> getHalfVariants(String stoneType)
      Returns the masonry half-slab variant keys for the given stone type.

    • getStoneTypes

      public static Set<String> getStoneTypes()
      Returns every registered stone type that has masonry variants.

    • detectStoneType

      public static String detectStoneType(String blockKey, String[] substitutions)
      Detects the stone type by first checking the clicked block's own key, then falling back to scanning the substitution array.

      Checking the block key first prevents mis-detection when a block's substitution list contains entries from multiple stone families (e.g. Rock_Basalt's subs may also include Rock_Stone entries).

      Parameters:
      blockKey - the BlockType.getId() of the clicked block (nullable)
      substitutions - the existing chisel substitution keys
      Returns:
      the detected stone type (normalised), or null

    • detectStoneType

      public static String detectStoneType(String[] substitutions)
      Detects the stone type by examining the existing substitution keys. Looks for keys that start with a known Rock-block prefix (e.g. "Rock_Stone", "Rock_Basalt") and returns the matching stone type, or null if none could be determined.
      Parameters:
      substitutions - the existing chisel substitution keys
      Returns:
      the detected stone type (normalised), or null

    • injectChiselStates

      public static void injectChiselStates()
      Attaches a Chisel.Data (with the merged substitution list) to every masonry variant BlockType so they are recognised as chiselable blocks at runtime.

      Must be called after all asset packs have been loaded (i.e. from start(), not setup()).

    • deriveExistingVariants

      public static String[] deriveExistingVariants(String[] substitutions, String suffix)
      For each substitution key, checks if key + suffix exists as a registered BlockType and, if so, adds it to the result.
      Parameters:
      substitutions - the base substitution keys (e.g. "Rock_Stone_Brick")
      suffix - the suffix to append (e.g. "_Stairs" or "_Half")
      Returns:
      array of valid derived keys, or null if substitutions was null

    • deriveExistingRoofing

      public static String[] deriveExistingRoofing(String[] substitutions)
      Derives roofing variants by checking all roof sub-variants (_Roof, _Roof_Flat, etc.) for each substitution key.
